comments: Bagley III (DET) is in the paint for less than three seconds when the shot is imminent.
Cunningham (DET) makes marginal body contact with Barrett (NYK) as he moves alongside him during his drive to the basket and shot attempt.
Barrett (NYK) makes incidental "high-five" contact with Cunningham (DET) after the release that does not affect his driving shot attempt.
Bey (DET) braces himself for the contact from Barrett (NYK) as the two meet at the same point on the driving shot attempt. Following the contact, Barrett releases away.
Stewart (DET) establishes himself in a screening position in the path of Burks (NYK) and firms up to absorb the oncoming contact.
Barrett (NYK) moves alongside Bey (DET) while maintaining a legal guarding position before swiping down to make contact with Bey's right arm that affects his driving shot attempt.
Bey (DET) extends his chest into Barrett's (NYK) body and delivers contact that affects his SQBR during the drive.
Barrett's (NYK) left foot remains in-bounds on his baseline drive.
Robinson (NYK) blocks Cunningham's (DET) driving shot attempt before it has reached its apex.
Quickley (NYK) moves alongside Cunningham (DET) and makes marginal contact with him while defending the driving shot attempt.

Stewart (DET) attempts to retrieve the rebound and makes marginal contact to Robinson's (NYK) face. Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Cunningham (DET) slightly extends his left arm and makes marginal contact into Burks' (NYK) side as Burks' momentum is carrying him forward during the drive.
Burks (NYK) legally dislodges the ball from Cunningham's (DET) hands during his jump shot attempt. Any additional contact during the loose ball is deemed incidental.
